Subject: RE: [cantera] question about freely propagating flame in phyton

Sven,

Mdot is used as an initial guess for the flowfield.  The actual mdot is part
of the solution.  Once the initial temperature guess has been specified, the
user needs to choose a temperature at a location to hold constant.  This is
done by:

	flame.setFixedTemperature(900.0);

Then the user needs to specify that this flame is adiabatic

	flame.setAdiabaticFlame();

Once this is done then the solution can be obtained by running:

	flame.solve(loglevel=1,refine_grid);

Karl



-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf
Of cantera_user
Sent: Wednesday, June 22, 2005 11:25 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] question about freely propagating flame in phyton


Hello guys,
can anyone give a brief description on how the new freely propagating
flame tools works, please? In the beginning you have to choose mdot e.
g. but it is not used in the further routines anymore. Can anyone
please explain shortly how it works, and what would be the best method
to use. I would really like to calculate some flame speeds for n-
heptane.
Thanks in advance for an answer

Sven
